publicwhip.spmotion: *S1M-1988 Mr Duncan McNeil: IBM: 50 Years in Greenock—That the Parliament notes that June 2001 marks the 50th anniversary in Greenock of the computer firm IBM; notes the considerable role which the firm has played in the economic and social regeneration of the local community; congratulates it on helping to retain Inverclyde’s status as the manufacturing export capital of Scotland, and wishes the plant and its workforce continued success.
S1M-1988 IBM: 50 Years in Greenock (lodged on 1 June 2001) Trish Godman*
S1M-1988 IBM: 50 Years in Greenock (lodged on 1 June 2001) Alex Neil*
S1M-1988 IBM: 50 Years in Greenock (lodged on 1 June 2001) Fiona McLeod*, Mr Kenneth Gibson*
S1M-1988 IBM: 50 Years in Greenock (lodged on 1 June 2001) Nick Johnston*

S1M-1988 Mr Duncan McNeil: IBM: 50 Years in Greenock—That the Parliament notes that June 2001 marks the 50th anniversary in Greenock of the computer firm IBM; notes the considerable role which the firm has played in the economic and social regeneration of the local community; congratulates it on helping to retain Inverclyde’s status as the manufacturing export capital of Scotland, and wishes the plant and its workforce continued success. Supported by: Trish Godman, Alex Neil, Fiona McLeod, Mr Kenneth Gibson, Nick Johnston
S1M-1988 IBM: 50 Years in Greenock (lodged on 1 June 2001) Irene Oldfather*
S1M-1988 IBM: 50 Years in Greenock (lodged on 1 June 2001) Janis Hughes*, Tricia Marwick*, Mr Lloyd Quinan*
S1M-1988 IBM: 50 Years in Greenock (lodged on 1 June 2001) Mr Brian Monteith*, Dr Richard Simpson*, Mr Kenneth Macintosh*, Kay Ullrich*

S1M-1988 Mr Duncan McNeil: IBM: 50 Years in Greenock—That the Parliament notes that June 2001 marks the 50th anniversary in Greenock of the computer firm IBM; notes the considerable role which the firm has played in the economic and social regeneration of the local community; congratulates it on helping to retain Inverclyde’s status as the manufacturing export capital of Scotland, and wishes the plant and its workforce continued success. Supported by: Trish Godman, Alex Neil, Fiona McLeod, Mr Kenneth Gibson, Nick Johnston, Irene Oldfather, Janis Hughes, Tricia Marwick, Mr Lloyd Quinan, Mr Brian Monteith, Dr Richard Simpson, Mr Kenneth Macintosh, Kay Ullrich, Ian Jenkins*
S1M-1988 IBM: 50 Years in Greenock (lodged on 1 June 2001) Andrew Wilson*
S1M-1988 IBM: 50 Years in Greenock (lodged on 1 June 2001) Bill Butler*, Mr John McAllion*
S1M-1988 IBM: 50 Years in Greenock (lodged on 1 June 2001) Mr Michael McMahon*, Elaine Thomson*
S1M-1988 IBM: 50 Years in Greenock (lodged on 1 June 2001) Margaret Jamieson*, George Lyon*

S1M-1988 Mr Duncan McNeil: IBM: 50 Years in Greenock—That the Parliament notes that June 2001 marks the 50th anniversary in Greenock of the computer firm IBM; notes the considerable role which the firm has played in the economic and social regeneration of the local community; congratulates it on helping to retain Inverclyde’s status as the manufacturing export capital of Scotland, and wishes the plant and its workforce continued success. Supported by: Trish Godman, Alex Neil, Fiona McLeod, Mr Kenneth Gibson, Nick Johnston, Irene Oldfather, Janis Hughes, Tricia Marwick, Mr Lloyd Quinan, Mr Brian Monteith, Dr Richard Simpson, Mr Kenneth Macintosh, Kay Ullrich, Ian Jenkins, Andrew Wilson, Bill Butler, Mr John McAllion, Mr Michael McMahon, Elaine Thomson, Margaret Jamieson, George Lyon
S1M-1988 IBM: 50 Years in Greenock (lodged on 1 June 2001) Brian Fitzpatrick*

S1M-1988 Mr Duncan McNeil: IBM: 50 Years in Greenock—That the Parliament notes that June 2001 marks the 50th anniversary in Greenock of the computer firm IBM; notes the considerable role which the firm has played in the economic and social regeneration of the local community; congratulates it on helping to retain Inverclyde’s status as the manufacturing export capital of Scotland, and wishes the plant and its workforce continued success. Supported by: Trish Godman, Alex Neil, Fiona McLeod, Mr Kenneth Gibson, Nick Johnston, Irene Oldfather, Janis Hughes, Tricia Marwick, Mr Lloyd Quinan, Mr Brian Monteith, Dr Richard Simpson, Mr Kenneth Macintosh, Kay Ullrich, Ian Jenkins, Andrew Wilson, Bill Butler, Mr John McAllion, Mr Michael McMahon, Elaine Thomson, Margaret Jamieson, George Lyon, Brian Fitzpatrick
